thread.section_title: Las Vegas Sun Stories: Arts & Entertainment
thread.title: Strip Scribbles: Jennifer Lopez, Britney Spears dancer, Elton John, Billie Jean King
thread.title_full: Strip Scribbles: Jennifer Lopez, Britney Spears dancer, Elton John, Billie Jean King

title: Strip Scribbles: Jennifer Lopez, Britney Spears dancer, Elton John, Billie Jean King
text:
Launch slideshow » 
Music superstar and 2016 resident headliner Jennifer Lopez will give a sneak peek of her new Strip show when she hosts the 2015 American Music Awards on ABC on Nov. 22 from Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. J.Lo’s show “All I Have” kicks off Jan. 20 at Axis at Planet Hollywood. 
Singers Joe Jonas and Charlie Puth will announce nominees in six categories on ABC’s “Good Morning America” on Tuesday. J.Lo’s preview of “All I Have” will be seen in more than 160 countries, ensuring a box office bonanza for her new show. 
Global icon Jennifer, who was named People Magazine’s first Most Beautiful Woman in the World, has amassed more than $2 million in box office grosses and more than $75 million in record sales. She recently performed at the 2015 iHeartRadio Music Festival at MGM Grand Garden Arena and hosted at Chateau Nightclub in Paris Las Vegas. 
TOP-TO-TOE NAKED: All the clothes came off to display his well-chiseled body when Britney Spears lead dancer from her “Britney: Piece of Me” residency at Axis shot his all-nude calendar. Photographer Kevin McDermott took Willie Gomez into the heart of the desert near Las Vegas for the provocative shoot, which will be Willie’s 2016 calendar titled “Stark.” Launch slideshow » 
The photos are beautiful, and Willie even managed a nude, upside-down balancing act standing on only one hand. I don’t know if pop princess Britney will permit it to be sold at her Axis show, but it’s certainly going to steam up holiday sales. 
GAY RODEO AT SOUTH POINT: For the first time, South Point Arena and Equestrian Center will host the International Gay Rodeo Association’s World Gay Rodeo Finals this weekend after moving from Fort Worth, Texas. The action-packed finals Saturday and Sunday showcase the best national and international riders and is the culmination of a season-long series of competitions in the U.S. and Canada. 
WGRF brings the Top 20 point-earning cowboys and cowgirls to compete in Las Vegas for the title of 2015 WGRF champions. WGRF events include calf and team roping, horse barrel racing, flag racing, pole bending, bull riding, steer riding, bronc riding and chute dogging. Additionally, there are three “camp” events likely to be crowd favorites: steer decorating, goat dressing and wild drag race in which a team of three try to get a drag queen on the back of a bucking steer. 
LOVE-40? It’s time for backspins, breakpoints and backhand smashes. Last year, Caesars Palace headliner Sir Elton John and tennis legend Billie Jean King played their all-star charity Smash Hits matches at Royal Albert Hall in London. Now with Elton’s residency return to the Colosseum, the 23rd-annual fundraiser is Monday for the first time on the fountain forecourt of Caesars. Launch slideshow » 
In the pro-celebrity matchups, Elton will be partnered with Martina Navratilova against hometown heroes Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf . Elton and Billie Jean will coach other teams that include James Blake, Tracy Austin, Andy Roddick, Lindsay Davenport and Mardy Fish . Funds raised will benefit AFAN and the Elton John AIDS Foundation. 
FOOD & BEVERAGE: Longtime Las Vegas headliner Gordie Brown has been honored with his own cocktail, the Golden Brown, at Minus 5 Ice Bar in Monte Carlo. 
Impressionist Gordie, who is celebrating 2,000 shows with his residency at Golden Nugget downtown, had the first taste of the drink made from ginger vodka, honey scotch and sweet and sour topped with a splash of pineapple juice served cold as ice in Minus 5 glassware carved from ice. 
Gordie’s cocktail joins other celebrity cocktails including Holly Madison, Carrot Top, Terry Fator, Michael Godard, Veronic, Human Nature, “Rock of Ages” and “Fantasy.” 
Congratulations to Shake Shack on the opening of its second Las Vegas location today. Now in addition to its New York-New York outlet, there’s a location at Downtown Summerlin. New on the menu: cranberry ginger lemonade and seasonal pumpkin pie dessert known as Oh My Concrete with vanilla frozen custard blended with pumpkin and topped with whipped cream. Launch slideshow » 
ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATIONS: It’s been 10 years that cigar smokers have supported Casa Fuente in the Forum Shops at Caesars. Carlos Fuente will lead his family here this weekend to celebrate a decade with a dinner party at nearby Spago on Friday night and a Saturday afternoon smoke-in at the store. 
I’m told that he’s bringing the rarest and finest of his private-reserve collection from the Dominican Republic originally grown with Cuban seeds when they fled that Communist nation during the revolution. 
Since opening 17 years ago, 75 Cirque du Soleil performers have performed more than 8,000 “O” shows in, on and above their 1.5 million gallon pool at Bellagio. To mark the astounding achievement, locals will be able to purchase tickets to the aquatic masterpiece for $100 apiece this month. 
MACAU GAMING WORRIES: Over the next six months, Las Vegas hotel kingpins are set to open properties in Macau that equal the number of rooms available there. This doubling of new-room inventory is causing serious concerns there for our Las Vegas hoteliers because recent figures for gaming with Chinese government crackdown has shown a devastating drop. 
Last month, there was a 33 percent year-over-year monthly comparison drop, slightly better than the 36 percent drop in August. Wall Street bankers monitoring MGM Resorts, Steve Wynn and Sheldon Adelson ’s properties there predict overall that Macau will show another 35 percent drop for October and a similar drop for all of 2015 versus last year. Chinese and Macau authorities have pledged to support gaming and the economy there because of the slowdown. 
STAR SURVEILLANCE Jimmy Fallon 
Members of Blue Man Group at Monte Carlo moving to the Luxor on Nov. 20 had double-TV duty Tuesday night. They appeared on “The Late Show With Jimmy Fallon” as mystery guests in a phone booth skit with Hugh Jackman and Shaquille O’Neal . Earlier, they popped up on the weekly “End of the Show Show” segment on NBC’s “Best Time Ever With Neil Patrick Harris.” 
TONIGHT’S TIPS 
Mother-and-daughter dynamic duo Naomi Judd and Wynonna Judd open their “Girls Night Out” nine-show run at the Venetian. “As a daughter, it’s wonderful to be able to celebrate your mother,” said Wynonna during their arrival Tuesday morning. “This is a chance to celebrate her. You will hear all The Judds hits.”
